body.p: Thus, in the absence of the practical expedient in paragraph 5.4.7 of IFRS 9, an entity would generally apply the requirements in paragraphs 5.4.3 or B5.4.6 of IFRS 9 to a change required by the reform, by recalculating the carrying amount of a financial instrument with any difference recognised in profit or loss. In addition, an entity would be required to use the original effective interest rate (ie the interest rate benchmark preceding the transition to the alternative benchmark rate) to recognise interest revenue or interest expense over the remaining life of the financial instrument.
